  • Method Details

    • mergeUsingDeltaE2000

      public static int mergeUsingDeltaE2000(ImageExt img, int[] labels, double thresh, MergeLabels.METHOD method)
      merge adjacent labeled regions if the deltaE2000 color difference between two adjacent regions is less than the given thresh.
      Parameters:
      img -
      labels - input labels, they are updated in place with merged labels
      thresh - threshold for the deltaE2000 color difference. The JND (just noticeable difference) threshold is about 2.3 and the maximum value is 20? (TODO: calculate this). Caveat is that the if the method is MEAN of color histograms of regions are taken as the representative color for the region, and so a threshold between 0 and 1.0 performs better. For MODE,
      method - mean or mode
      Returns:
      number of unique labels

    • mergeCIELUVPolarTheta

      public static int mergeCIELUVPolarTheta(GreyscaleImage img, int[] labels, int thresh)
      experimental method to merge labels where input image is CIE LUV polar theta image. not yet tested. The values in a pixel are circular, so differences are the min(max-(abs(a-b)), abs(a-b)), hence, this "merging" is very different than would be applied to a standard greyscale image.
      Parameters:
      img - CIE LUV polar theta image created with maxValue=255.
      labels - input labels, they are updated in place with merged labels
      thresh - threshold lower limit for which the difference will be considered different regions.
      Returns:
      number of unique labels

    • mergeCIELUVPolarThetaH

      public static int mergeCIELUVPolarThetaH(GreyscaleImage img, int[] labels, double thresh)
      experimental method to merge labels where input image is CIE LUV polar theta image and histograms are used. not yet tested. The values in a pixel are circular, so differences are the min(max-(abs(a-b)), abs(a-b)), hence, this "merging" is very different than would be applied to a standard greyscale image.
      Parameters:
      img - CIE LUV polar theta image created with maxValue=255.
      labels - input labels, they are updated in place with merged labels
      thresh - value between 0 and 1 for similarity threshold, above which regions will be merged.
      Returns:
      number of unique labels

    • mergeWithMinGrad

      public static int mergeWithMinGrad(ImageExt img, int[] labels, double thresh, GreyscaleImage gradImg)
      the color descriptor of each label is determined from the point which has the min gradient for each label region as was done in the SuperPixels algorithm.
      Parameters:
      img -
      labels -
      thresh -
      Returns:
      the number of unique labels after merging

    • calculateCentroids

      public static int[][] calculateCentroids(int[] labels, int width)
      calculate centroids of labeled region and return them as
      Parameters:
      labels - labels for each point where range of label value = 0 to nUniqeLabels - 1
      width - width of image the labels are relative to.
      Returns:
      centroids of the labeled regions as result[0] = {x0, y0}
